title: Jungle data gathering / Help us know your early game better
body:
Hey guys, we have a change coming soon to a PBE near you meant to help us improve our understanding of how people jungle (especially early game).
When we tried to poke into some of the responses we got it became very apparent that people address the jungle in **very **different manners. Lots of small changes add up to huge swings in what champions look like coming out of their first clear.
What this means for us is that it's hard to balance early jungle without some more insight, so we're calling on you guys to help. 

We're putting a change that is **PBE ONLY** to help build this shared understanding of how junglers jungle individually: A set of buffs that track your jungle progress in the first portion of the jungle.

By giving us a direct peak at how you interact with the jungle you give us a chance to improve it. Maybe by making a mechanism more clear, rebalancing a camp, or many other systems. But first this type of information would help us know **which** systems.

Here's what the buffs look like:
http://i.imgur.com/GqqauMg.png
(The primary buff)

http://i.imgur.com/13KFFU4.png
(After taking 1 camp. In this case, Krugs)

http://i.imgur.com/B12h25a.png
(After taking 2 camps. Krugs and then Razorbeaks)

It would be super useful to get these value from you guys from champions you expect to play in the jungle. I'm especially interested in the contrast of:
The results of these after you tried it how you normally play the jungle.
And
The results of these after you tried to optimize beyond what you normally do (possibly with the help of these buffs).

Please post your findings here: http://boards.pbe.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/champions-gameplay-feedback/eEWEardJ-request-screenshots-of-jungle-stats :)

replies.body: Could this potentially be moved to Custom games or even normals in the future? I don't play on the PBE but I would be very interested to test out different methods of jungling using these buffs.

I would want to make it toggleable if we were to do that. It's not out of the question if there's value in it beyond this gathering of data, just not right now since such a toggle would take a bit of work (so we would have to judge it versus other things as always).
this is genius! and you guys havent approved my pbe ;-;

I love to use some junglers that have not recieved some love in a while, so it might be useful I guess to see how junglers below "top tier" deal with their early clears now.

I specially love {{champion:28}} Evelynn, and her first clear is one of the hardest: it is very difficult to do 3 camps before first back if you do not get a nice pull. I usually start (and Smite) Gromp and then Blue, walking towards red with both pots used, and having Smite up barely in time to kill the Brambleback before it kills me. Then I usually make the risky move of ganking mid or top (even though my HP is quite low) if I see the laner pushed and if I'm successful, it reeeeeally helps me get my game going, but if it doesn't look well it's #1 priority to not die and lose double buffs because it's really hard to recover from that.

I start Q, then E and most often I will get E again lvl3 if I'm going for a gank, Q if I can't, and rarely W if I see that being more useful to get in (or out) that early gank than the extra dmg on another spell. I will get Trailblazer for my second clear and switch it to Stalker's when it's time for serious ganking and immediately enchant with Devourer. Then I like getting Cutlass, Wit's End and upgrade BoRK for that mulptiple on-hit burst damage, since nowadays AD on-hit feels like the only working build on Eve (I liked to play her more Hybrid but well).

I hope this is useful, either for insight into this particular champ or just in general!
You know how E applies on-hit effects now? The krug buff is an on-hit effect and it seriously makes the first clear less painful, though you'll still be lucky to get more than three camps.
Many of us nerds like statistics and shit :)
Allow me to give you a visual demonstration of what early game jungling looks like.
Actually this would be more realistic
quick, be constructive, people, before haters appear...
Are you also taking this data on specific champs or is this just for the jungle in general?
Specific champions. Specifically: "champions *you *expect to play in the jungle".

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Reinboom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8bjulQZi,comment-id=00010001,timestamp=2015-02-17T11:00:24.951+0000)
>
> Specific champions. Specifically: "champions *you *expect to play in the jungle".

Does this take into account leashes? I know that with a good leash I can usually clear 3-4 camps without going b on any champion, and without I can do 2-3 (this is for champions with bad clear times, sustain, or mitigation. I can do Rek'Sai without ever going b, even without a leash, but even with the best of leashes my Eve has to go b in 2-3 camps).

{{champion:76}} Nidalee can now stay in the jungle forever without really needing to back. She's got so much damage with her 6 spells, and such good sustain, that the only reason she has to go back is either getting her killing tools for the ganks or poor mana management. I think her jungle sustain pre-5 should be severely nerfed.

and how exactly would you carry out said changes without decimating her solo lane or support lane viability? do you want to reduce her damage? solo lane nerf, cant kill secure very well and farms under tower.

want to reduce her ranges or her heal? solo lane and bot lane nerf. cant sustain and severe penalty to mobility and harass. which at both points would leave you better off picking a champ that could do either job better than whatever waste of space you'd take up as a nerfed Nid in a role that she cant compete in anymore.

The community as a whole has said that a large numbers of champs need to be looked at, and Riot is looking at the jungle at the moment so they can do that. so please, before we get back to the "nerf everything that i find oppressive because it farms me" stage of the game, lets let them work out how they're gonna change the jungle. THEN we can figure out who needs a buff or nerf. just a simple favor for my and everyone's sake.

I don't know why you're getting so defensive against me, and I don't want to assume, but you should understand that I'm merely trying to help by pointing out something that I find worth looking at. If I knew the solution to the problem, I would have suggested it without a doubt, but I don't and that means that 1.- maybe someone with more knowledge of the game might want to look it up or 2.- maybe I'm wrong and/or overlooking something important on the matter.

So please don't be quick to jump to conclusions on anyone who suggests they percieve something is too powerful. Let there be dialogue before trying to shut someone down.

sorry if that seemed overly defensive. i'm simply tired of the 10k threads of NERF Lee, Vi, J4, Rek, and everyone else viable while at the same time complaining that there is a distinct lack of diversity in the jungle because everyone is over nerfed. it's clear that you have a gripe against Nidalee at the moment but its entirely possible that with whatever forthcoming changes they make to the jungle after the data they receive she may not need to be gutted or hardly nerfed at all.

I can already see in this thread that some people have off meta champs that they play that are either suffering from a bad route or simply a bad kit that comes along with an unloved off meta champ.

if Riot is looking to buff and nerf with the data given, lets give them all the data we can. Calling for toning down a champion, in spite of however true it may be, just bears to major relevance to the task at hand. they're measureing clear speed and healthy clears. if it's clear that Nid is too good, they'll see it, but maybe they wont do much more than wonder how to bring everyone else closer instead of Olafing her.

Oh I actually like Nida quite a lot and although I haven't played her much yet (I recently bought her), I can already tell that she is comparatively awesome at clearing and sustaining in the jungle, and although she's not the best ganker around (until you get your skills up for it), she's not lacking poke, assassination or chasing power either. I also follow a couple of streamers and youtubers and see just how good she is when you can properly use her (unlike me atm), and well, I just fail to see relevant tradeoffs. She ***is*** rather squishy, but she can deal great damage before she even closes in, then burst you down, and even if it goes bad she has decent escapes and a heal. I don't want her gutted at all (man I loved what they did to her in the rework) and I'm not even asking for a nerf, I just wanted to raise awareness on this just so more players (like you here) can join in the debate.

Most junglers have to choose between great clears (either safe or fast) or ganking power (either by CC or dmg), but she's getting the better of both worlds with fast clears, sustain and high burst and poke damage.

Well we could take some of the passive back and not have this discution, she would still be able to clear and not be so efficient at it. Like no stun or no extra damage/movement.
Because it's true she can last forever out there with proper runes and masteries.
Still her ganks ain't that reliable so she doesn't need one anyway. No reliable gab close nor cc. It's like shutting down a yi, proper warding and being on the opposite side of your minions are enough to not enable any possibility to her.

This would be a very useful feature to use to data mine in customs on live rather than PBE.

A lot of players don't have PBE accounts and those that do tend to not take the games too seriously or aren't very good.

A feature like this that goes live would get a wider sample range of player skill to get the best indicator of jungle changes.

Cool idea. :) Time to break out the PBE account, again. What data are you guys at Riot specifically interested in? First 5/6/7 min? Level 6?

Agree with Anyael below, this sounds like something really interesting for custom games, too. Is this tracker calculated server-side or client-side?

Only the first 4 camps are shown in the buffs. That's beyond the barrier of the check for "can jungle" versus "can't jungle"

Note: these don't try to figure out if a champion can "Jungle well" - there's a lot more data than this required for that.
Naut and most tank junglers are screwed then.

Lies, Nautilus has such amazing clears in the jungle right now. People just build him wrong. Go AD, Attack Speed, Armor, and MR, then start Krugs, smite for buff, clear red, then clear wolves and gank, or skip wolves, go Gromp, smite for buff, clear blue, and the go back. If you choose to gank, you can easily go back into your jungle and clear the next two camps. It all depends on your first two camps and how much damage you take. Right now, I have a 75% win rate with him this season out of 16 games. You honestly just build tanky and you will wreck people as a jungle Nautilus. Also, don't build Mobis, either build swifties or ninja tabi.

You just suggested swifties and nobody exploded hatred on you?

+1 miracle point  :D

ps. love me some swifties!
Swifties are so good, people just don't understand why. Mobility boots are good, but I don't like the movement speed being reduced by combat. What a waste.

so 4 camps = can jungle? So amumu, who has to back after 3 camps or risk dying to the 4th can't jungle?

Glad a nerf to Smite range vs champs is coming soon thanks to mumu.

This experiment isn't prescriptive. I'm not saying that it any specific champion should never be able to jungle if they can't reach four camps now.

Four camps just happens to be the point that identifies how well a champion can continue to jungle right now. If we discover something like "A lot of players struggle with even the third camp on Jungler-Champ-X and have no realistic hope of continuing their jungle", then now we have something very specific that we can act on. Making that champ not be wrecked early so badly (as well as the specific numbers required to most accurately change).
Mummy can stay in the jungle forever if you do the right route with the right setup.

i should not have to base my build 100% on the jungle.  my runes and masteries should be impacted but not fully.   i should not need armor quints or lifesteal quints to successful jungle.

also i would like to be able to use runes that could give me a better late game build like CD per level glyphs or movement speed quints for gank potential.  i should be able to go masteries that will help me throughout the game, not a mastery setup solely meant for level's 1-5.


yes, you can jungle with pretty much anyone, but you'd be a srs handicap to your team unless your the typical junglers atm.

This is a long needed necessity and I'm so glad you guys are finally trying to gather data on the new jungle through the player experience. My only concern is that most players will use the top tier junglers instead of those who this data is much more sorely needed for. Jarvan, Vi, and Lee Sin do not need to be tested using this. Other junglers do. 

So guys, say no to: Jarvan IV, Lee Sin, Vi

Say yes to: Evelynn, Elise, Trundle, Zac, Garen, Skarner, Kha'zix, Volibear, Nautilus, Hecarim, Nunu, Warwick, Sion, Alistar, Udyr, Amumu, Maokai, Fizz, Pantheon, Shyvana, Nocturne, Aatrox, Diana, and Rengar.

Edit: Forgot Maokai!

Where's Sejuani?
{{champion:113}}
I agree with your post, but it's insanity that you'd include Garen but not Maokai.
Lol is that jungle lulu?

> [{quoted}](name=DanofDemacia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8bjulQZi,comment-id=0028,timestamp=2015-02-17T17:06:43.051+0000)
>
> Lol is that jungle lulu?

Lulu does as she pleases.
i Know i did jungle lulu yesterday and went 15/4/3 or somethign like that

You gotta check out {{champion:119}}  in the new jungle.

Challenging Smite, Chilling Smite, Ranger's Smite... no matter.

{{champion:119}} does it all with style!
LESS WORRY ABOUT GAMPLAY, AND MORE WORRY ABOUT THE GARBAGE PATCHER. PEOPLE NEED ANSWERS TO WHY THIS COMPANY LACKS AT HAVING A STABLE GAME CLIENT.

Best Rito Post Ever! I don't have an PBE account, but this is the way Riot should do it, listen to the community feedback before everything goes live!

To the people of PBE! Plz try the following champions so Riot can get some Data! {{champion:111}} {{champion:106}} {{champion:28}} {{champion:120}} {{champion:31}} {{champion:121}} {{champion:33}} {{champion:72}} {{champion:154}} {{champion:57}} {{champion:54}}
I'd definitely like to help in this. Too bad I haven't a PBE account...yet?

should release this to live but only available in custom games

the pbe crowd isn't the best at testing much of anything considering all the bugs that keep going to live - see xin zhao q
Maybe after this, people'll realize just how weak most junglers are, and we can possibly get some drastic changes. :D

So you guys do do work. Woah. I thought you all just sat around wondering when you're going to buff Zed and nerf Taric. 
Seems good. Does this mean you'll actually use the PBE for something starting now?

If you mean for experimenting on it? Possibly.
We've been attempting to push things in a more experimental state out to PBE for a bit. Trickles of it are starting to show (e.g. this or Mandrake).

We do use PBE for other things and it's pretty important. It catches the most egregious bugs, build issues, makes sure things generally work when it goes through the full ringer of matchmaking. And certain teams respond to it pretty quickly or even let content sit there for a bit (SRU was on PBE for a very long time).
For design experimentation we're still learning how to best use it. Like this experiment!

> [{quoted}](name=Riot Reinboom,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=8bjulQZi,comment-id=005f0000,timestamp=2015-02-27T08:20:54.018+0000)
>
> If you mean for experimenting on it? Possibly.
> We've been attempting to push things in a more experimental state out to PBE for a bit. Trickles of it are starting to show (e.g. this or Mandrake).
> 
> We do use PBE for other things and it's pretty important. It catches the most egregious bugs, build issues, makes sure things generally work when it goes through the full ringer of matchmaking. And certain teams respond to it pretty quickly or even let content sit there for a bit (SRU was on PBE for a very long time).
> For design experimentation we're still learning how to best use it. Like this experiment!

I think you're missing the disdain and anger in that post (or you're purposefully ignorning it, which has its merits) but I think the kicker is why are things pushed from PBE to live when they're not tested enough and still in need of serious polish. Why are things like the Cass rework and Veigar's rework pushed to live against massively negative feedback, but Mordekaiser's proposed "make him a bruiser" changes and Galio's Debonair skin rolled back?

There doesn't seem to be consistency, especially not if the PBE is intended for feedback and changes.

I can remember when Lunar Goddess Diana was released to the PBE there wasn't enough time to make the changes the community wanted, because she was being pushed to live. **Why do we even *bother* with the PBE, when stuff like this is the norm?**

> It catches the most egregious bugs, 

{{champion:268}} Yep.

> Maybe by making a mechanic more clear

Making a repair person more clear? I'm confused! :-P

Yes. Exactly.

http://i.imgur.com/RkebzC4.png?1
He's not clear. O.o

Geez. After dumping all the s4 changes that let almost everyone jungle, after everyone cried about the jungle hitting harder than a truck, after everyone asking for more exp and gold, only NOW you decide to track the damage? After the preseason is gone? 

As a jungler I want to be able to carry a game. I'm not a duo laner that is giving up his gold to the AD carry.  

Bring counter jungle back and make it effective. Make the jungle item deal more damage to the jungle. I wanna feel the king of the jungle and not get behind as the top laner/mid/adc can plow through my jungle because they have a sustain item and can do my job better than me.
Or just scrap machete from the game. Make it a passive for smite. Let us start with a doran's/cloth/flask if we want.
Or make the smite be the active of machete. So we can have the same summoners that our laners have.

Or make every laner take a hit as the jungler and suport. Slow their build and make them buy an especific item so your minions give you the actual amount of gold. No "Minion knife"? -10 gold per minion. Ah, no need for sustain in that item, since minions are tanked by other minios or the tower =]. 

Please, don't let the "experiment wards" that works for 5 minutes go through. You already gave the laners free wards to stop ganks.   The next step is no fog of war vs junglers.

Played my whole season 4 as a jungler. Now I prefer any lane because I can have more gold, more exp and way more snowball potential.
